Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 53rd overall pick, by Atlanta in 1974...
Injured on 8/21/1977 with a Fractured Hand, out for 4-5 weeks...
Injured on 4/18/1978 with a Inflamed Posterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 5-6 weeks...
Had first career hit on 4/2/1981, off Rick Baldwin (HOU)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/7/1981, off Ron Schueler (HOU)...
Drove in 6 runs against Pittsburgh on 6/10/1984...
Injured on 9/15/1984 with a Torn Abdominal Muscle, out for 3 weeks...
Injured on 8/3/1985 with a Fractured Wrist, out for 4 weeks...
Released by Atlanta on 9/1/1986...
Signed as a free agent by Minnesota on 9/1/1986 to a 1-year deal worth $1,336,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/14/1987, hitting .619 with 4 HR, 9 RBI...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1988...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/7/1990, hitting .545 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
